ca.diro.UserHandlingUtils.Actions

Class UserAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.diro.UserHandlingUtils.Actions.UserAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddEventAction, CancelEventAction, CloseSessionAction, CommentEventAction, CreateUserAccountAction, ModifyAccountAction, OpenSessionAction, UnauthorizedAction

    public abstract class UserAction
extends Object
implements IAction
    Represents the actions that can be performed by a user that affect the user itself. This could also have been done using a multitude of AbstractHandlers. However, I find this way cleaner and I wanted a way to call every command using a list of UserActions if required. (For instance, if we need to use a queue for requests.)
    Author:
    lavoiedn
